basics.name: Yixiao (Jimmy) Fang
basics.summary: A person who likes to think rationally.

education.area: Robotics, Artificial Intelligence, and Computer Vision
education.studyType: Master of Science in Electrical and Computer Engineering
Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering
courses: Senior Thesis: Dynamic View Synthesis in Unstructured Field Environment
Exchange student at Zhejiang University, China (2020.08 - 2021.05)

work.name: Zoox Inc.
highlights: Worked on high-fidelity sensor simulation for validating AV perception models with generative AI
Supervisors: Eric Schafer and Phillipe Burlina

work.name: LifeFoundry Inc.
highlights: Worked on improving AGVs communication reliability, built vision-guided control systems for robotic arms, and developed automated vision pipelines to boost bio-manufacture lab efficiency and throughput

volunteer.organization: International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA)
highlights: Served as a reviewer for submitted papers to ICRA, evaluating contributions in robotics and automation research

awards.title: Promise of Excellence Fellowship
awards.awarder: University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign ECE Department
awards.summary: This fellowship is awarded to incoming graduate students who demonstrate the potential to achieve great things in the field of Electrical and Computer Engineering.

awards.title: A.R. 'Buck' Knight Scholarship
awards.awarder: University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign ECE Department
awards.summary: This award was established by Betty Ann Knight to honor the memory of her father, Professor A.R. 'Buck' Knight. Professor Knight, is a member of the faculty of the Department of Electrical Engineering from 1913 to 1954, was well-known for his numerous contributions to campus and community affairs and for his concerns for students.

awards.title: The Grainger College of Engineering James Scholar
awards.awarder: University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign Grainger College of Engineering
awards.summary: The James Scholar Program is a University-wide program established to encourage undergraduate research, independent study and the opportunity to work with renowned faculty.
